titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the World War II subject collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Linda Bernard

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-05-10T15:09-0700

change.item: Revised to add box 102 with embroidered armband.
Declassified materials returned to collection (in newly created Box 101, with some Balkan Peninsula materials that were shifted from Box 6) by Sarah Patton.
Descriptions of reformatted audiovisual items updated.
Revised to update encoding by Samira Bozorgi.
Updated extent statement for additional increment.
Container list updated after rehousing materials, code updated to current OAC standards.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::World War II Subject Collection)//EN" "reg_100.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

physdesc.extent: 94 manuscript boxes, 4 card file boxes, 4 oversize boxes, 1 oversize folder, 10 videocassettes, 2 sound discs, memorabilia

did.abstract: Leaflets, pamphlets, proclamations, clippings, propaganda, manuals, other printed matter, letters, reports, memoranda, maps, memorabilia, and miscellany relating to military operations and home front conditions in many countries during World War II, including material on military occupations, prisoners of war, and forced labor. Also includes material on resistance movements in various countries, especially France.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Use copies of some sound recordings in this collection are available for immediate access. To listen to other sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], World War II subject collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives over various years.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Leaflets, pamphlets, proclamations, clippings, propaganda, manuals, other printed matter, letters, reports, memoranda, maps, memorabilia, and miscellany relating to military operations and home front conditions in many countries during World War II, including material on military occupations, prisoners of war, and forced labor. Also includes material on resistance movements in various countries, especially France.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Biographical notes, broadsides, brochures, bulletins, cartoons, correspondence, diaries, flyers, forms, handbooks, identification papers, instructions, leaflets, lists, manuals, maps, memoirs, memoranda, newsletters, official documents, orders, pamphlets, photographs, postcards, posters, press releases, proclamations, propaganda, ration cards, regulations, reports, rosters, serial issues, studies, underground literature, writings, clippings and other printed matter, and miscellany, arranged alphabetically by country and then by subject or physical form.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Envelopes opened by the censor addressed to the Hoover Library, Stanford, California.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets relating to the attitude of the Churches vis-a-vis fascism and nazism.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlet issued by the United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration, entitled UNRRA: Organization, Aims and Progress.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Programs, booklets, pamphlets, brochures, serial issues, and memorabilia relating to the commemorations of the fiftieth anniversaries of the D-Day landings in Normandy and of the Battle of the Bulge.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets relating to the origins of the war. Includes a compilation of documents from the period 1937-1938. In English and Polish.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Proceedings of the Round Table Conference "Germany's Thirty Years' War" held at the Savoy Hotel, London.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlet by Edward Puacz relating to various exiled governments and pamphlets issued by the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace relating to European governments-in-exile.

did.unittitle: General, Justice for the Jews and The Jews in the Family of Nations,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Chart of operations in the European Theater.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, leaflets, and reports, in a variety of languages, distributed by the Allied Forces in Europe, Asia, and the Arab world.

did.unittitle: French propaganda leaflets (in German), including a pamphlet by Hermann Rauschning denouncing Hitler; and British air raid leaflets (in English, French and German) dropped by the R.A.F., as well as other leaflets relating to the paper salvage campaign in Great Britain
American pamphlet issued by the U.S. Office of War Information entitled Modern Leaflet Bombing,
Printing plate used for leaflets dropped on Japanese cities several days ahead of bombing, advising citizens to evacuate

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mostly German propaganda, in various languages, distributed in Europe and Asia. Includes one issue of Front und Heimat (German soldier's newspaper).

did.unittitle: Pamphlets issued by the German authorities in Poland,
Leaflet distributed after the Japanese Army landed in Indonesia,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, brochures, and speeches, including on world organization and world peace. Includes Richard N. Coudenhove-Kalergi, "Peace Aims as War Weapons," Martha Jelenko, Post-War Reconstruction: Major Programs and Opinions, and Wm. Reitmann, Lasting World Peace and Total World-Disarmament on a Divine-Angelic Basis. Also includes a report by the Women's Employment Federation on post-war opportunities for women.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings by Paul van Zeeland and others relating to his activities to secure European peace and union. Includes an undated typescript on his wartime activities and the book jacket for Paul van Zeeland au service de son temps.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Williams, Pierce, "Preliminary Summary of Report on Refugees and Displaced Persons: An Urgent United Nations Problem."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlet published by the Mutual Defense League containing a speech and articles by Isidore Nagler relating to the role of labor in the struggle against fascism and the problems facing the international trade union movement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, leaflets, ordinances, and other printed matter relating to various aspects of World War II and its aftermath, and reports (in German and in English) relating mainly to resistance activities in German-occupied Europe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlet published by Freiheit fur Osterreich, entitled Austria's Freedom Front: Manifesto of the Austrian Underground Movement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Studies, reports, handbooks, maps, photographs, diagrams, and printed matter relating to the political, economic, social, and military conditions in the Balkans (Albania, Bulgaria, Greece, and Yugoslavia) and to the location of strategic power plants and industries in Yugoslavia. Includes two intelligence reports on the Cetnik and partisan resistance movements in Yugoslavia prepared for the Allied Military headquarters, Balkans, and one folder of photocopies of underground literature (in Slovenian and Serbo-Croatian) relating to resistance activities in Yugoslavia during World War II. Includes declassified records returned to file after February 2016 release by Hoover.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlet issued by the Belgian Information Center relating to the escape of two Belgian air officers to Great Britain by airplane and to conditions in Belgium.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Leaflets, posters, proclamations, press releases, underground literature, writings, and clippings. In French, Flemish, and English.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Proclamations and miscellany relating to the resistance movement in German-occupied Belgium during World War II and to the entry of Allied troops into Brussels in September 1944. In French, Flemish, and German.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlet relating to the Burma Road through the China-Burma-India Theater.

did.unittitle: Occupation of Rangoon by the Imperial Japanese Army,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Propaganda-style flyer announcing the "annihilation" of the American, British, Chinese and Dutch forces. Typed English translation is provided.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlet issued by Inter-Allied Publications, entitled Unknown Country: The Story of Czechoslovakia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two leaflets (mimeographed in Czech) issued by the resistance movement in German-occupied Czechoslovakia, and a translation (printed) of a clandestine Czech resistance pamphlet, entitled Svejk in the Protectorate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Leaflets relating to the resistance movement in German-occupied Denmark during World War II and to the post-war reconstruction of Denmark.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Issues of The Danish Listening Post put out by the National America Denmark Association.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, leaflets, serial issues, and miscellany. Includes both pro-Vichy and pro-resistance propaganda, blank forms for travel permit requests used in German-occupied France, and a few post-war political items. In French and German.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and memoranda relating to the transportation of Spanish refugees in the vicinity of Toulouse to Germany for forced labor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Underground materials, including memoranda, instructions, orders, reports, letters, maps, charts, clandestine newspapers, bulletins, and leaflets, distributed by various resistance groups. Boxes 17-19 contain duplicates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, leaflets, serial issues, maps, manuals, and bulletins relating to Germany's participation in World War II and to its post-war status. Includes a few pre-war items relating to German fascism.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous lists, notes, and statistics relating to the administration of justice by German occupation authorities in the Netherlands during World War II. In German and Dutch.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Handbook describing the economic status and rights of the German soldier.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Holograph diary of an unidentified German soldier.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Issues of News Flashes from Germany.

did.unittitle: Extracts from letters written by an unidentified anti-Nazi German,
Pamphlet by Erik Erikson, entitled Herrn Thomas Mann, relating to Thomas Mann and conditions in Germany during the war,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reports, memoranda, regulations, and miscellany relating to the importation and supervision of foreign workers in Germany during World War II. Includes some miscellaneous material relating to the structure of the Hitlerjugend and other Nazi organizations, and to Nazi racial ideology and historical and cultural outlook. See also: oversize Hitler Youth hierarchy diagram in map case.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlet relating to German foreign policy from Otto von Bismarck to Adolf Hitler.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of a typescript memoir authored by an unidentified German prisoner of war. Relates to conditions of imprisonment of German prisoners of war in Russia during World War II.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlet relating to Germany's secret air rearmament from 1919 to 1933.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets relating to prospects for democracy in post-war Germany and to industrial disarmament of aggressor states.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Flyers and pamphlets relating to resistance among the German people.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlet by Siegbert Kahn relating to the Committee's activities, particularly its radio broadcasts to the German people.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Biographical notes relating to members of the German anti-Nazi resistance movement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, correspondence, and clippings relating to war crimes committed in various German-occupied European countries and to Allied demands for reparations. In English and Polish.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlet by Stephen Gorski relating to German war crimes and the Nuremberg Trial.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, serial issues, leaflets, bulletins, newsletters, maps, and posters relating to British politics, conditions in Great Britain during World War II, war aims, civil defense, the wartime economy, and post-war reconstruction. Includes issuances of various groups in Great Britain during the war.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Brochure relating to coastal defense operations by the British Air Force.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Manual, entitled We Shall Fight in the Streets! Guide to Street Fighting.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlet issued by the Allied Forces 21st Army Group entitled Guidance in Making Arrangements for Liberated British Prisoners of War.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The American Friends of Greece, Greece 1821-1941.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Issues of the Greek War Relief Newsletter, put out by the Greek War Relief Association.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlet relating to war crimes committed in Greece by Germany, Italy, and Bulgaria.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Leaflets and pamphlets relating to the Greek resistance movement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Holograph diary of an unidentified Hungarian soldier.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: In Italian and English. Includes George A. Tesoro, The Bankruptcy of Fascist Economy through the Eyes of Italian Economists (1943).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Issues of Facts from Italy, put out by the Committee for a Democratic Foreign Policy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings from Italian newspapers relating to the execution of S. Simoni, Italian Army General, by German occupation troops in Italy.

did.unittitle: Issue of Cronache della regione Lombardia, relating to underground movements in Lombardy,
Four leaflets urging Italians and Romans in particular to rise against fascism and the German occupation,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Daily duty roster for some unidentified Japanese garrison quartered in an unknown location. Entries run from February 1 to 16.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed translation of the Japanese declaration of war on the U.S. and Great Britain.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Translations of articles from Japanese newspapers relating to world political, military, and diplomatic affairs during the first years of World War II.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Proclamation issued by Japanese naval officials and relating to regulations for civilian prisoners of war captured at Wake Island and being transported from the island on Japanese naval vessels.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Declassified records returned to file after February 2016 release by Hoover. Consists of two reports: "The Japanese Occupation Technique in the Field of Money and Banking," Foreign Economic Administration, Liberated Areas Branch, February 1944; and "Japan's War Economy, 1943-1944," Foreign Economic Administration, Special Areas Branch, Far East Enemy Division, February 1945. Also stamped Far Eastern Civil Affairs Training School at Stanford University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Declassified records returned to file after February 2016 release by Hoover. Consists of a report, "Summary Industrial Survey of Korea," Foreign Economic Administration, Enemy Branch, Japanese Special Services Staff. Also stamped Far Eastern Civil Affairs Training School at Stanford University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mainly pro-Allied propaganda, especially from Mexico.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous memorabilia, satirical postcards, proclamations, and press clippings,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relates to the course of World War II in the Netherlands, including the German occupation, Allied propaganda, Dutch press coverage of the war, the liberation of Amsterdam on May 5, 1945, and photocopies of Dutch underground literature (in Dutch).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Three letters from Dutch workers transported to Germany for forced labor relating to working conditions in Germany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Proclamations, identification cards, registration forms and miscellany, issued by the German occupation authorities in the Netherlands, relating to regulations of the Dutch civilian population during World War II. In Dutch and German.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Proclamations issued by the Dutch and Allied military authorities relating to the entry of Allied troops into the Netherlands in 1945.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Summaries of reports relating to the transportation of 2000 Dutch officers from the Netherlands to a prison camp in Germany in May 1942 and to living conditions in the camp.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Flyers, leaflets, proclamations, and newsletters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of letters to the editor of the San Francisco News, written by William Moler-Loswick and relating mainly to Norway during World War II.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Propaganda leaflets distributed by the resistance movement in German-occupied Norway during World War II. In German and Norwegian.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photostats of reports, memoranda, letters, and orders pertaining to the guerrilla warfare of Chinese volunteers in the Philippines against the Japanese during World War II. In English and Chinese.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings from American daily newspapers and from Yiddish newspapers in the U.S., Canada, Mexico, Argentina, Uruguay, and South Africa relating to German atrocities in occupied Poland, persecution and extermination of Jews, activities of Polish emigre groups, and the case of Victor Alter and Henryk Erlich. In English and Yiddish.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Leaflets urging Poles in the Soviet Union to join the Anders Army.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets relating to conditions in occupied Poland, German atrocities, the persecution and extermination of Jews, the Polish underground army and various resistance groups, and the Warsaw Uprising.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Proclamations, underground literature, other printed matter, and charts relating to events and conditions in German-occupied Poland, especially to Polish resistance movements. In English, Polish, and German.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: One book illustrated with photographs depicting the air battle of Ploesti (1944 April 5 - August 19).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Proclamations relating to regulations imposed upon the civilian population by the German occupation authorities. In German, Russian, and Ukrainian.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlet relating to the invasion, occupation, and ultimate liberation of Ukraine in 1944.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Anti-Nazi cartoons by various Soviet artists. Captions in Russian and English.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed statement by Oscar Lange, Polish ambassador and delegate for Poland to the United Nations Security Council, at the meeting of the Security Council in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets and newsletters relating to economic and social conditions in the United States and to the American government. Includes proceedings of the Eighth Pan American Child Congress, Washington, D.C., 1942 May 2-9.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, conference proceedings, and newsletters. Includes issuances of the Congress of Racial Equality and the National Urban League.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed matter, including manuals and guidebooks issued by the U.S. Army and Navy, and pamphlets and guidebooks relating to the U.S. Armed Forces issued by commercial publishers during World War II. Includes manuals, handbooks, and regulations issued by the War Department, and a report on radar capabilities released by the joint Board on Scientific Information Policy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Booklet, entitled Target Germany: The Army Air Forces' Official Story of the VIII Bomber Command's First Year Over Europe; and booklet relating to the Air Force's report on the special bombing missions over Japan, 1945 July 20 - August 14. In English and Japanese.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Communications and printed matter relating to the end of World War II in the Pacific. Includes an admission ticket to the San Francisco plenary session of the United Nations Conference on World Organization.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlet reprinting two speeches delivered at the Tenth Anniversary National Conference of the American Committee for Protection of Foreign Born, New York, 1943 October 30-31, relating to the contribution of foreign-born Americans to the war effort; and a pamphlet relating to Americans of German descent.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Speech by Ernest W. Gibson, "Should Our Ships Convoy Arms to Britain?"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Speeches and leaflets relating to American neutrality. Includes a broadside reproducing a leaflet (printed) mailed by B. K. Wheeler, U.S. Senator from Montana, urging U.S. neutrality in World War II, and letters (typewritten) in reply from two soldiers who received copies of the leaflet; and a speech by Robert S. Field.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets relating to plans for post-war economic conversion and social adjustment.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reports, press releases, lists, and miscellany relating to conditions in prisoner of war camps in the U.S. during World War II and to the exchange of U.S. and Axis civilian nationals in captivity.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relates to U.S. military activities and civil defense during World War II, including manuals, servicemen's newspaper issues, bulletins, newsletters, leaflets, letters to and from American soldiers, and a mimeographed transcript of an NBC television program, The Decision to Drop the Bomb.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mimeographed typescript of the agreement between the Yugoslav government and the United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration relating to the provision of civilian relief in Yugoslavia at the end of World War II.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Charts, maps, and photocopies of instruments of surrender.

did.unittitle: Hitler Youth hierarchy diagram (originally housed in box 22)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Issued by the Comite d'Histoire de la 2eme Guerre Mondiale, concerning occupied France and illustrating the suffering of people and the actions of the resistance groups in France.

did.unittitle: Photocopies of the instrument of surrender of Japan to the Allied Powers,
18 maps outlining Allied and Axis positions in various parts of the world, mainly in Western Europe,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a few post-war maps.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Military insignia, pair of horse's spectacles, pin, and office stamp.

did.unittitle: Japanese military insignia for the ranks of major general, colonel, lieutenant colonel, and major in the Japanese Army

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Made in Luettringhausen concentration camp near Remscheid, Germany, by inmates in solitary confinement, during World War II. These spectacles were evidently used by General Rommel's horses in his North Africa offensive.

did.unittitle: 1 pin and 1 office stamp from the Nazi occupation government of Norway

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sound discs relating to the Burma Road and to the attack on Pearl Harbor.

did.unittitle: Burma Road radio news broadcast relating to the re-opening of the Burma Road
Sound recording of interviews with Americans in various parts of the U.S. on the evening war with Japan was declared, relating to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes transcript.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This addition to the collection has not yet been described. Please let the Hoover Institution Archives know if you would like to see this material described. Contact us at hooverarchivesinfo@stanford.edu
